Ha. Niet  keer spoelen,  volledige reservoirs. Met een kortingsvoucher los ik dit niet op, en om eerlijk te zijn heb ik vrij weinig vertrouwen in het hele reparatiebedrijf. Message: We just got ours.It has an auto shut off after it sits a while. Our old Saeco, Stayed on all the time,  hrs a day, seven days a week for almost five years now. This one we have to restart it anytime anyone wants a coffee, about  or  times a day. Every time we turn it back on, we have to wait about a minute for it to be ready to brew coffee, and at the end of that minute it always squirts out a couple of ounces of plain water. If you don't have a cup under it, it just runs into the drip tray. If you have a cup under it it catches the water, but then my expresso is diluted. Message: Hi there, I have been using my laser hair remover for over a month now and dont seem to be seeing any results. Could there be any reasons as to why? Thanks Is this what you need?  Hey, yes I make sure I shave before using the product on all areas I am using it in. I hold it in the correct area (the white light comes on to show its ready) I dont fake tan, I do however have a natural tan. I always use the most intense option, or the one just below it depending on the area I am using it on. Thank you Yeah the screen is all clean there isnt any burnt spots on it and I always overlap so not sure what else it could be? My hair is dark though not blonde so it is quite easy to see it with the tan if that makes sense? I will keep trying it and see how I get on and let you know. Thank you

Message: I just wanted to DM you and say thank you so much to Philips for this blender. We have had it in my family home for  years and it was used almost daily. I tried contacting  but they do not answer my requests. We are a Spanish company and the research will be conducted in Zaragoza.  Thanks for your reply. I cannot send you a message though. Could you provide me with an email address? Hi, thanks for the message. We are looking for a polysomnographic system with the following specs: - allows sleep scoring according to AASM
-  EEG channels, references against mastoids
- EOG
- EMG
- ECG
- nasal airflow
- respiratory effort
- pulse oximetry If you could forward me to a sales rep in the sleep health department, that would be great. I tried to find contacts on the spanish philips website and sent several mails to  but I never received an answer. Thank you very much

Message:
Don't buy Philips Series  (S3520/06) shavers. The first one died one week before warranty expired. Got it replaced by a new one, which died a month after warranty expired.

Shouldn't buy  products or I will have to change my Twitter handle to "beardedvolvoman" soon! Hoi, ik weet niet wat ik hiermee moet, een scheerapparaat wat precies na de garantietermijn kapot gaat. Ik heb het open gemaakt en kan zien dat de elektronica is uitgebrand. Is niet zozeer slijtage als wel een productiefout of misschien wel een ontwerpfout. Intussen zal ik een ander apparaat moeten kopen, want dit krijg je niet meer economisch gerepareerd, als ik berhaupt al aan reserve-onderdelen kan komen. Wordt denk ik geen Philips meer, na  toestellen achter elkaar die het begeven hebben en een ouder toestel wat nog goed werkt maar waarvan het scheerhoofd is afgebroken en nieuwe onderdelen zijn niet meer te koop. Een en ander in reactie op het verzoek onder deze tweet: Dat mag, stuur het naar

Hello there.  
I am a long time product user - soothers, bottle feeding products.... and have recommended then to my moms friends because I love the products.  

I have purchased numerous soothers of your brand - like  plus purchases.  They have been my go to and used for my kids and replaced regularity.  
Recently I purchased two packages of the ultra air soothers as we were ready to size up for our youngest.  
I was sterilizing them and noticed that water was getting INSIDE the soother!! 
I was shocked. Never has this happened for us in all of the soother we have purchased.   These ones must be defective or something?  I cant imagine water in there could be a good thing and assume that mold would start to grow or something. 
Anyways, as a long time product purchased and supporter I thought you should know about the faulty products we purchased.

Yes, please. These bottles are terrible. I'm convinced we have a bad batch The states nan nan   -607-4919 Ty Yes, assembled correctly. I've watched many videos and talked to many people in groups about these bottles. We heat the milk in the bottles in the bottle warmer. We check to make sure the nipple is still aligned.

We just hand wash the bottles in hot soapy water.

They leak when we turn them down to feed our baby and if we turn it right back up it leaks, a lot. More than a tablespoon, and yes we make sure the notch is facing up It's leaking at A All  bottles that we got do this, and we've been using them since the end of April  wow, terrible customer service. I've lost ounces of my breast milk and you want me to buy these shitty bottles again with a "discount "?! You're out of your damn mind.  you won't replace your faulty bottles and want me to give your company more money? Nah...never. Unbelievable A refund would be preferred before I go ahead and throw out these bottles

Message:
Wonderful machine, But how do propose to empty the bean tank for cleaning the funnel when it is un detachable !  I wanna clean the funnel right now but there are still some beans in the tank !  its the HD7762  Saudi Arabia  Hello, yeah Ive already read the instruction manual in detail first thing before operating the machine, theres no mention of how to empty the bean tank, it just says that it is preferable that its empty! So I settled on waiting for the tanks to be nearly empty and then run several cycles of grinder cleaning until it cleans on an empty tank, there will be wastage but thats the only way that worked for me! Maybe in future models you can add a mechanism to empty tanks of remaining beans before the cleaning process !

But overall its a brilliant machine, wonderful customer service too ! Keep up the good work.
Summary_T5_1: The HD7762 Saudi Arabia is a brilliant machine, great customer service too!
Summary_T5_2: wonderful machine empty beans tank

So I settled on waiting for the tanks to be nearly empty and then run several cycles of grinder cleaning until it cleans on an empty tank, there will be wastage but thats the only way that worked for me! Its fresh Pasta time... again!  I completely love fresh #pasta and have been making my own pasta for years. Using my automatic pasta machine, pasta making is done in less than  min. and freezes well too. There is simply no quicker, more convenient way of making #fresh pasta yourself.

Message: Hi, I just wanted to share my great customer experience with you. I bought a Phillips electric toothbrush from Aldi at the end of last year. Unfortunately it stopped working at the weekend. I searched for any paperwork I could find but unfortunately in the hectic Christmas present season I appeared to have mis-filed it (in the recycling no doubt!). I called your customer services team yesterday lunchtime and immediately connected to a very helpful guy called George. After explaining the situation and emailing over a photo of the serial number a replacement was arranged. Was amazed when the doorbell just rung to find my replacement being delivered - less than hrs after my phone call. Its often so easy to moan when things go wrong, but I think its really important to recognise when things go right! So thanks to George (what a lovely friendly and helpful team member of yours!) and all involved in my great customer experience! (IT-philips-9018285)
Summary_T5_1: Aldi's George arranged a replacement for my Philips toothbrush. The doorbell rung to find the replacement being delivered - less than hrs after my phone call!

This morning I have shaved my leg and noticed it started to sting really really badly. I stopped and checked, I've been cut all over my leg! It's really really really sore! The case has split and the blade it exposed! Surely this should not happen?

It's only used be myself and only on my legs a few times a year due my sensitivity. 

It's never been in water or dropped etc.

Message:
Hi, I just bought a toothbrush maybe  months ago. It's battery is either not charging or not lasting long enough to last even one cycle. Can you help?  My last Philips brush lasted for about  years. It died so I decided to pry open the bottom to see if I could do anything. It was full of water and i was able to get it working for a while. I just pryed open this one this morning. No water  but I hope that doesn't void any warranty Ok will do But the brush used to just indicate no battery with the the  pulses. Now it's entirely unresponsive. Will try charging for  hrs. Thanks The brush is unresponsive Morning, 
So I bought another toothbrush. I tried charging my old toothbrush that wasn't working on the new charger and now it works normally. So it was the charger after all, not the toothbrush. Now I have two brushes lol. Thank you for your help :)

I have soldiered on trying to use the best I can but today having almost cut myself have realised this is now dangerous. As I look reviews online, its obvious that this weakness is a design fault. Please can advise what to do I have always bought Phillips beads trimmers but this one has been a real disappointment nan nan nan As you can see, the connecting arms that link both blades into the shaver have simply sheared off Im assuming due to weakness in the design Great. Message:
Hi. 
I purchased a full mask and piping for my Philips sleep apnea machine through the local chemist near where I live. 
After about three or four months I took the inner part of the mask out to have a look at because I felt that I wasnt getting the right pressure while breathing. 
I noticed the plastic/ skin there had peeled off about and inch and a half long and was basically not breathing properly after only three or for months. 
Now I went back to the chemist and they said that was there understanding that there is no warranty with this sort of issue. 
Three to four months old. 
My previous one lasted seven years before I renewed it. 
So I was told to repurchase that part which doesnt sound fair. 
I did Leave very disappointed with what I was told and had a go glueing that piece down and that last for a bout  weeks. 
But what am I supposed to do now, pay out more money for a new piece??
Not happy.

After about three or four months I took the inner part of the mask out to have a look at because I wasnt getting the right pressure while breathing. Now they said that was there understanding that there is no warranty with this sort of issue.

A recall of the cpap machines and the information on  your web site could not be more obscure if you tried.  For example, you tell patients to contact the physicians to find out information; however, today is /15 and you say that you are not providing information on exactly which machines are affected until /23.  A little dumb, don't you think?  You have listed models that "may" be affected, however, when one looks at the machine, the name of the models does not match what is actually printed on the machine illustrated.  For example, I have a Dreamstation.  I have no idea if it is Model  or  because the model number printed on the machine says it is DSX500T11C.  No where that I see do  you provide patients with a cross reference.  You are creating confusion instead of clarity.  You are making a simple task complicated by not empowering patients with correct and complete information.
References:

https://www.usa.philips.com/healthcare/e/sleep/communications/src-update#section_2

Message:
Hi,

I have a  Ambilight TV which is synced with my Philips Hue (two Playbars under the TV). 

The TV won't acknowledge any of the bulbs on my Hub and thus won't connect. 

I've reset the TV more times than I can count and resynced the Hub also. Tried everything that normally works short of a software update. Usually when I reach this stage (as this unfortunately isn't the first time) a patch gets released for the TV and hey presto problems solved. 

All software on all devices is up to date. Can you confirm when a fix will be coming please as my main reason for owning the TV and investing in Hue is the Ambilight which is amazing when it works but that's only -90% of the time. Hi Benoit,

Thank you for pointing me in the right direction and I hope you enjoyed the weekend. 

Have a great week. 

Kind regards, 

Kiel

I do appreciate the costumer service, though!
With kind regards
Nina

Message: We use your app.  Why ever would Philips not communicate a recall via the app?  It appears this is from back in April, and we have to find out randomly through Facebook posts? You have an absolute means of communication that utilizes serial number for affected units.  Why would Philips ignore that avenue for alerting patients?  That doesn't sound very "leading provider" at all. We register these CPAP devices with our serial number and use DreamMapper to monitor usage. Its wildly irresponsible for Philips to not notify affected patients of a health recall since they have the serial number and contact information. There is no explanation for having to learn of this from a random Facebook post. Where is that end-to-end approach you claim to take, in the interest of clinical success?

Message: Hi my daughter uses A40 bipap machine every night due to her having muscular dystrophy. Obviously we have seen these machines being recalled. We have contacted the hospital who provided this machine to be told they are investigating. I don't feel this is good enough and as a company you should be telling hospitals to recall the equipment. Please advise Sam Greenway Well I don't believe it's faulty. Message:
I have a Phillip's Sonicare toothbrush,  I've been using it for about  months. Today I unscrewed it to see what replacement head I needed and it was all moldy! The head was hollow and the mold was up to the tip! I was disgusted and I'll never use another one of these toothbrushes again. Gross! I threw the toothbrush away and didn't take pictures. 

 I just wanted someone to be aware. It was one that the head unit sits inside the bottom prt, on top of the battery and a screw on piece holds it all together.

Message: I am so sick of buying lightbulbs that dont fit. The bit above the bayonet is too think on these  bulbs. I can never buy them again and this is my reminder not to. Remember when all bulbs just fit the same!!!  I'm in Australia. The part where the bayonet widens is much too thick/ shallow for most common bayonet light fittings so it won't go deep enough to secure.   . I don't have the receipt - no issues with $. It was a V B22. It's been a really common issue and I generally try and only buy bulbs that look exactly like old incandescent bulbs so they fit. Bayonet style. Not sure about screw in. Also, TBH. With an old w bulb, you knew what you were getting. Now it's so hard to know how truly bright or cold/warm the light will be.

Message: Dear Philips, can you please also bring to the US the Hair Clipper that you sell in the rest of the world? Europe, Australia The one with adjustable hair length capability, as pictured below. I would love to purchase this, but the ones you sell in the US (branded as Norelco) have been kind of ugly and dont work for me design-wise. You should probably go ahead and put that Norelco brand to rest soon Your Philips brand name is already strong enough in North America, so you dont need to tether / hyphenate anymore. Please drop the Norelco brand. Its retro, its baggage, its a liability Philips is not married to Norelco, so stop hyphenating the brand. And please bring more European designs to the American market!

Message: Hi. I own  Philips Aquatouch shavers and bought a new set of heads for one of them (S5050/04 shaver and new SH50 heads) The heads that were in it were the Comfortcut heads which you no longer do. The replacement newer heads are the Multi Precision, which I ordered from Amazon. My problem is that they are simply not as good as my old Comfortcut blades. I have gone to great lengths to confirm this ie: shave half my face with the shaver that has the Multi Precision heads, and the other half with my other shaver (AT899/06) with the old Comfortcut heads. I have swapped the heads between the two shavers and found that the Multi Precision heads are just as poor in my AT899 shaver. I can get a decent shave from the Multi Precision heads, but it takes a long time (too long) I realise it is quite easy to fit the heads wrong, but this is not the case. Can you offer any explanation as to why the Multi Precision heads perform so poorly. Thank you

Message: Hello! I had to clean the water tank and to make it easier, I removed the Aquaclean filter which has been installed and activated a while ago. Now, when I will need to reinstall the filter, should I follow the same steps or just connect it and go on with it? Thank you! Hello! Thank you for your quick reply! I checked the manual, but there was nothing regarding my question. I just put the filter back in the water tank and when I turned on the machine, the error light appeared and the start/stop button was flashing which i had to tap to continue. Afte that, the machine started to eliminate steam through the milk frother and then it was ready to use again, but it seemed that the coffee was tasting poorly. So, i decided to no longer use the filter and threw it. Now, the aquaclean blue light cannot be deactivated, although i tried to do so as in the manual. Thank you again and I m sorry for my big reply. I really like this machine and I hope I didn't damage it.  thank you!

Message: The recommended small circles are hard to get consistent. I can watch the progress on my phone and I get a pretty good shave. It's not perfect but I get a good enough shave. I'm the kind that doesn't want to spend a long time shaving. There is still a little irritation at the end. I won't use shave cream so I put up with the irritation. I will still recommend this Philips Norelco /84 Don't get me wrong. I like this new razor. In my mind I upgraded from a S9000 that I had for over  years. The  worked good but started to get loud. I'm not one to give up with out a good try. I love the app. and I am impressed that people are actively trying to help me get a comfortable shave. I really am impressed with this razor.

Message: My daughter used to take breastmilk from this bottle, then she stopped. She gets rather fussy and mad when we try to feed her. This makes me nervous, as I am her sole source of food. Any advice?  Thank you.  Philips Avent sorry, I was unclear. She will not take the bottle at all now. She moves her head away from it and gets super cranky. I will look into a different nipple, but Im not sure if that will do the trick. Message: I bought  Philips monitors in July  - first one failed in Aug , still under warrantly so was replaced. Second one has just failed, fortunately just in warranty - however they will take it away for repair which could be up to  days until returned - and if like me you rely on your home office to do your job this is not acceptable, how can you run an office without a screen!!! Fuming to say the least. Will never buy another Philips product again!! My Dells lasted well over years without a days trouble Philips UK & Ireland would be great if you offered a swap out, and honestly I'm sick of companies using the pandemic as an excuse!!!!!  Philips UK & Ireland and to add insult to Injury you want to  charge me  for a box to send it back for repairs, as after nearly  years I dont have the box........ And judging by the stream of other bad comments I have read about Philips Im not alone!!! Philips get your act together  Absolutely Sharyn De Vos.
Summary_T5_1: Philips UK & Ireland would be great if you offered a swap out, and honestly I'm sick of companies using the pandemic as an excuse!!!!!

Message:
Hello 

I just wanted to say a huge thank you. We were one of the first to jump on the air fryer bandwagon around  years ago. We purchased your top of the range at the time for quite a price. We have been using it with no issues at all. In the last few months we have noticed it starting to smoke and smell like old oil. I looked at trying to clean it however it was in places that would have been unsafe to clean and areas I could not get too. So we decided to get a new one. We looked at the XXL but that was out of our budget. We saw that you still sell our original air fryer and we bought one there and then. We took the extra two year warranty but know we will probably not need it. 
Again this is just a thank you and to let you know that your original air fryer lasted  years without an issue.

Thank you once again and the reason we stuck with Philips :) nan

Message:
I registered my Dreamstation CPAP unit to be updated as requested by Phillips, and we are waiting.......

Phillips says to contact the MD and the DME company for direction since I need to stop using the CPAP unit.  

My physician said to contact Phillips.

The DME company said to contact the MD as they have no information, cannot advise, and can only offer to sell me a new or refurbished unit.     

Also, my insurance WILL NOT pay for a replacement CPAP since I have another year to go on the defective one I have..... that I cannot use.

And on the phillips website it says: 
or patients using affected BiLevel PAP and CPAP devices: Discontinue use of your device and work with your physician or Durable Medical Equipment (DME) provider to determine the most appropriate options for continued treatment........" 

SO ONCE AGAIN, the consumer, the patient is the loser. Please let me know if there is any other direction. 

Thank you

Message: hi - i just signed up on Philips.co.uk for the newsletter.  i want to order an electric toothbrush and was waiting for the % off code well I just rec'd confirmation that I am on the subscriber list - at least I think.  it's in spanish and there's NO CODE! please can you send me the code asap.  my email is  yes that's correct. and no discount code Sorry that's way too much work I've informed you of the error that YOUR system made.
